/hr/bjw-s.github.io-helm-charts-app-temp.title: redis helm release
/hr/bjw-s.github.io-helm-charts-app-temp.name: redis
/hr/bjw-s.github.io-helm-charts-app-temp.doc:
Redis is an open-source, in-memory data structure store that is used as a database, cache, and message broker. It provides a fast and flexible solution for storing and retrieving data, making it an ideal choice for a wide range of use cases, including real-time analytics, session management, and more.

Redis is used by Authentik, Authelia, oauth2-proxy.

0:
mqtt:
  host: emqx
  topic_prefix: frigate
  user: ${SECRET_FRIGATE_MQTT_USER}
  password: ${SECRET_FRIGATE_MQTT_PASSWORD}
database:
  path: /data/frigate.db
detectors:
  coral:
    type: edgetpu
    device: pci
objects:
  track:
  - person
  - dog
  filters:
    person:
      min_area: 2500
      max_area: 100000
      threshold: 0.7
    dog:
      min_area: 1000
      max_area: 10000
      threshold: 0.7
ffmpeg:
  hwaccel_args:
  - -hwaccel
  - vaapi
  - -hwaccel_device
  - /dev/dri/renderD128
  - -hwaccel_output_format
  - yuv420p
  # Enable audio on recordings...
  # might cause issues on recording playback
  output_args:
    record: -f segment -segment_time 10 -segment_format mp4 -reset_timestamps 1 -strftime 1 -c:v copy -c:a aac
cameras:
  # --
  doorbell:
    ffmpeg:
      inputs:
      # Sub Stream
      # - path: rtsp://admin:${SECRET_DOORBELL_VIEWER_PASSWORD}@${SECRET_DOORBELL_IP_ADDRESS}:554/Streaming/Channels/102
      #   roles:
      #   - detect
      # Main Stream
      - path: rtsp://admin:${SECRET_DOORBELL_VIEWER_PASSWORD}@${SECRET_DOORBELL_IP_ADDRESS}:554/Streaming/Channels/101
        roles:
        - rtmp
        - detect
        - record
    detect:
      width: 720
      height: 576
      fps: 15
    record:
      enabled: True
      retain:
        days: 0
        mode: active_objects
      events:
        retain:
          default: 14
        objects:
          - person
          - dog
          - cat
    snapshots:
      enabled: True
      timestamp: False
      retain:
        default: 14
    rtmp:
      enabled: True
    
  front_door:
    # rtmp:
    #   enabled: false
    ffmpeg:
      inputs:
      # Main Stream
      - path: rtsp://frig:${SECRET_FRONT_DOOR_VIEWER_PASSWORD}@${SECRET_FRONT_DOOR_IP_ADDRESS}:554/Streaming/Channels/101
        roles:
        # - rtmp
        # - detect
        - record
      - path: rtsp://frig:${SECRET_FRONT_DOOR_VIEWER_PASSWORD}@${SECRET_FRONT_DOOR_IP_ADDRESS}:554/Streaming/Channels/102
        roles:
        - rtmp
        - detect
        # - record
        # - clips
    detect:
      width: 640
      height: 480
      fps: 15
    record:
      enabled: True
      retain:
        days: 0
        mode: active_objects
      events:
        retain:
          default: 14
        objects:
          - person
          - dog
          - cat
          - car
    snapshots:
      enabled: True
      timestamp: False
      retain:
        default: 14
    # rtmp:
    #   enabled: True

  garage:
    rtmp:
      enabled: false
    ffmpeg:
      inputs:
      # Main Stream
      - path: rtsp://frig:${SECRET_GARAGE_VIEWER_PASSWORD}@${SECRET_GARAGE_IP_ADDRESS}:554/Streaming/Channels/101
        roles:
        # - rtmp
        # - detect
        - record
      - path: rtsp://frig:${SECRET_GARAGE_VIEWER_PASSWORD}@${SECRET_GARAGE_IP_ADDRESS}:554/Streaming/Channels/102
        roles:
        - rtmp
        - detect
        # - record
        # - clips
    detect:
      width: 640
      height: 480
      fps: 30
    record:
      enabled: True
      retain:
        days: 0
        mode: active_objects
      events:
        retain:
          default: 14
        objects:
          - person
          - dog
          - cat
          - car
    snapshots:
      enabled: True
      timestamp: False
      retain:
        default: 14
    # rtmp:
    #   enabled: True

[cyberpower-ups]
  driver = usbhid-ups
  port = auto
  desc = "CyberPower CP1500 AVR"
  pollinterval = 10

[upsmon]
  password  = "${SECRET_NUT_PASSWORD}"
  actions = SET
  instcmds = ALL
  upsmon primary

MONITOR cyber-power@localhost:3493 1 upsmon "${SECRET_NUT_PASSWORD}" primary
SHUTDOWNCMD "/sbin/shutdown -h +0"
POWERDOWNFLAG /etc/killpower
POLLFREQ 15
POLLFREQALERT 5
HOSTSYNC 15

0:
host_script="/hostshm/smart_tbw_monitor.sh"
cat <<"EOF" > $host_script
declare -A tbw multipliers
tbw=(
  ["Samsung SSD 860"]="2400"
  ["Samsung SSD 970 EVO Plus 2TB"]="1200"
  ["WDC WDS400T1R0A"]="2500"
)
multipliers=(
  ["Samsung SSD 860"]="1"
  ["Samsung SSD 970 EVO Plus 2TB"]="10000"
  ["WDC WDS400T1R0A"]="1000000"
)
set -m
devices=$(lsblk | grep -E 'sda\s+|nvme0n1\s+' | awk '{print $1}')
for device in $${devices[@]}; do
  smart_output_line=$(smartctl -A /dev/$device | grep Written)
  lba_size_bytes=$(fdisk /dev/$device -l | grep 'Units' | awk '{print $8}')
  model=$(fdisk /dev/$device -l | grep model | sed -E 's/.*: //g' | awk '{$1=$1};1')
  multiplier=$${multipliers["$model"]}
  if [[ $smart_output_line =~ "LBA" ]]; then
    measurement=$(echo "$smart_output_line" | awk '{print $10}')
  elif [[ $smart_output_line =~ "Data" ]]; then
    measurement=$(echo "$smart_output_line" | awk '{print $4}' | tr -d ',')
  fi
  ssd_bytes_written=$(( measurement * lba_size_bytes * multiplier ))
  mfr_tbw=$${tbw["$model"]}
  percent_tbw_used=$(echo "scale=2; ( $ssd_bytes_written / 1000 / 1000 / 1000 / 1000) / $mfr_tbw" | bc -l)
  echo "$device,$model,$mfr_tbw,$ssd_bytes_written,$percent_tbw_used"
done
EOF
chroot /host bash /dev/shm/smart_tbw_monitor.sh
host_script="/hostshm/smart_temp_monitor.sh"
cat <<"EOF" > $host_script
set -m
devices=$(lsblk | grep -E 'sda\\s+|nvme0n1\\s+' | awk '{print $1}')
for device in $${devices[@]}; do
  smart_output_line=$(smartctl -A /dev/$device | grep Cel)
  model=$(fdisk /dev/$device -l | grep model | sed -E 's/.*: //g')
  if [[ $model =~ "Samsung SSD 860" ]]; then
    sensor=$(echo $smart_output_line | cut -f 2 -d' ')
    value=$(echo $smart_output_line | sed 's/ Celsius//g' | awk '{print $NF}')
  elif [[ $model =~ "WDC WDS400T1R0A" ]]; then
    sensor=$(echo $smart_output_line | cut -f 2 -d' ')
    value=$(echo $smart_output_line | sed 's/ Celsius//g' | awk '{print $10}')
  elif [[ $model =~ "Samsung SSD 970 EVO Plus 2TB" ]]; then
    sensor=$(echo $smart_output_line | sed 's/:.*//g')
    value=$(echo $smart_output_line | sed -E 's/.*\:\s+([0-9]+).*/\1/g')
  fi
  echo "$sensor,$model,$value"
done
EOF
chroot /host bash /dev/shm/smart_temp_monitor.sh
for sensor in /sys/class/thermal/thermal_zone*/temp; do 
  echo "$(echo $sensor|sed -E 's/.*(th.*[0-9]).*/\\1/g'),$(echo $sensor|sed -E 's/.*(th.*[0-9]).*/\\1/g'),$(( $(cat $sensor) / 1000 ))" 
done

[FILTER]
    Name                kubernetes
    Match               kube.*
    # We need the full DNS suffix as Windows only supports resolving names with this suffix
    # See: https://kubernetes.io/docs/setup/production-environment/windows/intro-windows-in-kubernetes/#dns-limitations
    Kube_URL            https://kubernetes.default.svc.cluster.local:443
    Buffer_Size         $${K8S_BUFFER_SIZE}
    K8S-Logging.Exclude $${K8S_LOGGING_EXCLUDE}

[FILTER]
    Name           record_modifier
    Match          *
    Record         cluster_name $${CLUSTER_NAME}

# Filter pings from oauth2-proxy
[FILTER]
    Name     grep
    Match    kube.*
    Exclude  log GET \\- \\"/ping\\"

# Filter kube-probe
[FILTER]
    Name     grep
    Match    kube.*
    Exclude  log kube\\-probe

# Filter nzbget/ingress jsonrpc hits
[FILTER]
    Name     grep
    Match    kube.*
    Exclude  log /POST \\/jsonrpc/ 

# Filter nextcloud propfind
[FILTER]
    Name     grep
    Match    kube.*
    Exclude  log /PROPFIND \\/remote\\.php\\/dav\\/files\\/tyler/ 

# Filter New Relic event truncated messages
[FILTER]
    Name     grep
    Match    kube.*
    Exclude  log /event truncated to NRDB limit/ 

# Filter wordpress
[FILTER]
    Name     grep
    Match    kube.*
    Exclude  log /GET \\/wp-login\\.php/ 

# Filter flux reconciliations
[FILTER]
    Name     grep
    Match    kube.*
    Exclude  log /([Rr]econcili?ation finished in|All dependencies are ready, proceeding with reconciliation)/

# Filter etcd status checks
[FILTER]
    Name     grep
    Match    kube.*
    Exclude  log /etcdserver\\/api\\/etcdhttp: \\/health OK \\(status code 200\\)/

# Filter longhorn instance manager debug
[FILTER]
    Name     grep
    Match    kube.*
    Exclude  log /longhorn\\-instance\\-manager.*debug/

# Filter unwanted containers
[FILTER]
    Name     grep
    Match    *
    Exclude  $kubernetes['container_name'] /(kube\\-events|calico\\-node|oauth2\\-proxy|kube\\-apiserver|mosquitto|event\\-exporter)/

# Filter unwanted namespaces
[FILTER]
    Name     grep
    Match    *
    Exclude  $kubernetes['namespace_name'] /(metallb\\-system)/

- job_name: tcp-syslog-vyos
  syslog:
    listen_address: 0.0.0.0:1514
    labels:
      node_name: freiburg1
- job_name: tcp-syslog-syno
  syslog:
    listen_address: 0.0.0.0:1515
    labels:
      node_name: nas1

[ups]
  driver = usbhid-ups
  port = auto
  desc = "APC Back-UPS RS 900G"
  vendorid = 051d
  productid = 0002
  serial = 3B1227X00136

[monuser]
  password = secret
  upsmon slave
[monmaster]
  password = secret
  upsmon master

server_url: https://${APP_DNS_HEADSCALE}:443
listen_addr: 0.0.0.0:8080
metrics_listen_addr: 0.0.0.0:9090
grpc_listen_addr: 127.0.0.1:50443
grpc_allow_insecure: false
private_key_path: /etc/headscale/private.key
noise:
  private_key_path: /etc/headscale/noise_private.key
db_type: postgres
db_host: pg-default-rw.pg.svc.cluster.local.
db_port: 5432
db_name: ${SECRET_HEADSCALE_PG_DBNAME}
db_user: ${SECRET_HEADSCALE_PG_USER}
db_pass: ${SECRET_HEADSCALE_PG_PASS}
db_ssl: true
tls_cert_path: "/tls/fullchain.pem"
tls_key_path: "/tls/privkey.pem"
log:
  format: json
  level: info
logtail:
  enabled: false
#acl_policy_path: "/etc/headscale/acl.hujson"
ip_prefixes:
  - ${CONFIG_HEADSCALE_IPV4}
randomize_client_port: false
dns_config:
  magic_dns: true
  base_domain: ${DNS_SHORT}
  override_local_dns: true
  nameservers:
    - ${IP_HOME_DNS}
  domains:
    - ${DNS_SHORT}
derp:
  server:
    enabled: true
    region_id: 999
    region_code: "Biohazard"
    region_name: "Biohazard-Home-Relay"
    stun_listen_addr: "0.0.0.0:3478"
    urls:
      - https://controlplane.tailscale.com/derpmap/default
  paths: []
  auto_update_enabled: true
  update_frequency: 24h
disable_check_updates: true
ephemeral_node_inactivity_timeout: 30m
node_update_check_interval: 10s
oidc:
  only_start_if_oidc_is_available: true
  issuer: "${SECRET_HEADSCALE_OIDC_URL}"
  client_id: "${SECRET_HEADSCALE_OIDC_ID}"
  client_secret: "${SECRET_HEADSCALE_OIDC_SECRET}"
  scope: ["openid", "profile", "email"]
  expiry: 30d
  use_expiry_from_token: false
  extra_params:
    domain_hint: ${DNS_MAIN}
  allowed_domains:
    - ${APP_DNS_AUTH}
    - ${DNS_MAIN}

domain = "${APP_DNS_KANIDM}"
origin = "https://${APP_DNS_KANIDM}"
tls_chain = "/tls/fullchain.pem"
tls_key = "/tls/privkey.pem"
role = "WriteReplica"
log_level = "verbose"
bindaddress = "[::]:8443"
ldapbindaddress = "[::]:3636"
trust_x_forward_for = true
db_path = "/data/kanidm.db"
db_fs_type = "other"
[online_backup]
path = "/backup/"
schedule = "0 0 22 * * * *"
versions = 7

[rack]
  driver = usbhid-ups
  port = auto
  pollinterval = 15
  desc = Rack UPS
